result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lashawn Mario James

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lashawn Mario James appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Alexander J. Kostal appeared by video for Lashawn Mario James.  Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND, expires 1/30/2023. Scheduling order signed and filed. State places offer on the record, will remain on the table until the final pretrial. Defense is rejecting the offer at this time. Case is adjourned in Branch 36.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Lashawn Mario James appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Alexander J. Kostal appeared by video for Lashawn Mario James.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: UWM Officer J. Castro. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 36.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Alexander Kostel has been appointed to represent the defendant and requests an adjournment, granted by the court. Matter is rescheduled, parties notified via email.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lashawn Mario James not in court, in custody. Abby Rockendorf in court, appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for status for a status of counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Status of Counsel in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Status conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Attorney Matthew Lamke

Defendant Lashawn Mario James in court, in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Lamke was present in person prior to the case being called on the record. Defendant states that he would like to have Attorney Lamke removed as counsel. Motion to withdraw as counsel is granted by the court. Defense counsel to notify Public Defender's Office to appoint new counsel for the defendant.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for status of counsel in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Status conference scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for LEVEL 5 SUPERVISION.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Defendant Lashawn Mario James in court, via zoom, with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Lashawn Mario James in custody.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW  
CASE HELD VIA ZOOM. Case set for Doctor's Report Return. Doctor's report received and filed.  Parties reviewed Dr. Collins' report and do not contest findings. State, defense and defendant waive right to hearing. Court found defendant competent to proceed and reinstated proceedings.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Lashawn Mario James not in court, in custody.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW  
Case set for Doctor's Report Return.  Parties request an adjournment as a report has yet to be filed. Case adjourned, branch 38.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Forensic evaluation ordered.  INITIAL APPEARANCE NOT HELD.  Trial court to address INITIAL APPEARANCE.

Defendant Lashawn Mario James in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Lashawn Mario James in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Lashawn Mario James appeared by video means with Attorney.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Commissioner tolls the time limits for the preliminary hearing.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Order for Competency Examination, signed and filed.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
